There are creeps like that, yeah. But that generally doesn't happen unless you're making a show of being a girl, trying to get dudes to treat you better or get something out of it.

As for why there aren't women in pros... there probably just aren't many with the right combination of skill and desire to do so. This isn't like real sports, where physical limitations must be considered. So you could believe there's some conspiracy stopping girl gamers from going pro, or just go with the simplest answer-- there just aren't any yet with the aptitude who also _want_ to be.

Think of it this way; if you don't want to get mugged, you don't walk around the bad part of town with your jewelry on display. That doesn't mean that anyone condones mugging, and that doesn't mean the mugger should be exempt from from punishment. But if you don't want the mugging _to occur in the first place_, it's on you to make good decisions. 

It doesn't matter that the overwhelming majority of players don't actually harass female players, just as it doesn't matter that the overwhelming majority just doesn't harass players in general. There will always be some who do. And it's far better for you if you take actions to prevent them doing it in the first place, than if you wait until after they already did to complain about it. Because by then, it's already had its negative impact.

Lets expand on your mugging analogy. 

If each time you stepped outside you got mugged, no matter where you walk, it's your fault right? If your entire town seems to be the bad part of town, it's your fault, yeah? You shouldn't complain that you're not safe no matter where you go. It's your fault for living in a bad part of town. Just move. Fuck trying to change things and improve the living conditions for all. Just move away.

It doesn't matter that the overwhelming majority of people don't mug others. There will always be people who do. It's far better for you to move away or never leave your house, than to wait until you got mugged and then call the police. Because by then, you've already been mugged. 

Cause fuck trying to change the environment and defend yourself to prevent others from experiencing what you did. Nah, it's their fault then. If damage has already been done, you can't hope to take actions to get rid of the damage source. Oh, a part of your house is on fire? Well it's already burned, don't try to put out the fire. It's already had its negative impact.

You've grossly misinterpreted my analogy. The most important part of it, the part that even makes it comparable to this situation, is the aspect of showing off your jewelry-- in this case, the jewelry being the girly summoner name. If you take that away, as you did, you're left with nothing. So your entire argument is based on a false premise-- the premise that the analogy works. Which without the summoner name as the jewelry, it doesn't. The comment I was responding to specifically said she doesn't say anything in game, just has that name. You've essentially removed the name and thus any cause anyone would have for harassing Arcade Lulu for being a girl, because without the girly name they have no indication that she is a girl. 

You attempted to argue against what you wanted to hear, not what I actually said. 

And you made it abundantly clear that you didn't even read past what you warped, because I stated in the comment that telling you to make smart decisions to protect yourself is not condoning the transgressions when they do happen. I didn't say you shouldn't report people who harass you, I said you shouldn't make yourself an easy target for it. That extends beyond feminine names or being a support name, you also shouldn't feed like hell if you don't like getting called out for feeding, or leave if you don't want to get reported for disconnecting.

My issue was not with the jewelry, it was with your conclusion. You said that the best course of action is to give up and change the user name. That is completely ignoring the fact that the other option is trying to push for change. If the environment is harmful, then you could either try to hide or fight back. Both are valid options, and it's based on weather or not you want immediate personal results or long term public results. The whole point of the OP and Arcade Lulu has been that they wish for the environment to change, not just for the harassment to stop for them but for it to go down for everyone in that predicament. You can't see past your own values of immediate results and put yourself in their shoes. The reason why your comments have garnered such a negative response is that you're outright telling them the best thing they can do is hide themselves away and not fight back. Weather or not that was your intention is a different story, and does not change the fact that your abrasiveness is not conductive towards proper discussion about this topic, or towards possible change. Additionally you didn't address any of my points, merely jumped to the defense of your analogy. Why should one hide that they're a girl? Why should someone just accept the fact that they have to hide themselves? Instead, why not push for change?

All arguments aside (like obviously the male conduct is inappropriate, but you're never going to convince 10-14y.o. boys to act with maturity...), **why do girls feel the need to identify their gender in their character name?**

I mean, I get that you have different likes. I get that girls may pick a name they find "cute". There are names that are kind of implying you're female versus names that explicitly identify it though. Honestly - I think girls (and many guys) pick names that are explicitly female because they're used to RPGs where for whatever ridiculous reason male players will give female characters free stuff pretty often and help them out a lot. However in a game like league, that doesn't happen. There's no "easy mode" for female players, so there's naturally going to be less of them. 

If it was really just the hate, females could just pick generic names and completely avoid the problem... (I agree it's a problem and shouldn't need to be avoided, but in the meantime why not avoid it?)

Not all ladies feel the need to have female in their names. Some people aren't that creative so they feel it's simpler just to put down such a basic thing in your username. It mainly depends on the person. Everyone has their own thoughts, opinions, and reasons that many people won't understand.

One cannot accurately claim that there is "barely" any female players in League, largely because we cammot access those numbers and information. People still just associate games to guys despite, and my information is old, about 48% of people who play games are female.

As for pro scene, they have to have a desire to do it along with the skills. Don't get me wrong, Master rank is amazing to a scrub like me; but most pros come up through challenger scouting.
